intro: Asplenium adulterinum subsp. presolanense, commonly known as the Presolán spleenwort, is a member of the fern family Polypodiaceae. It is a small, epiphytic or lithophytic fern that typically grows on rocks or tree trunks in humid, shaded environments. The plant has a compact rosette of lanceolate, dark green leaves with a smooth margin. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are located on the underside of the leaves. This subspecies is native to regions of South America, particularly in countries such as Colombia and Ecuador.
